abstract: An alliance of companies led by Google plans to roll out a common set of standards to allow developers to write programs for Google’s Orkut and other social networking Web sites.
snippet: An alliance of companies led by Google plans to roll out a common set of standards to allow developers to write programs for Google’s Orkut and other social networking Web sites.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 30 — Google and some of the Web’s leading social networks are teaming up to take on the new kid on the block — Facebook.

headline.main: Google and Friends to Gang Up on Facebook
headline.print_headline: For Google, A New Shot At Facebook

byline.original: By Miguel Helft and Brad Stone

abstract: A week after losing out to Microsoft in a bid to invest in Facebook, Google is hitting back.
lead_paragraph: A week after losing out to Microsoft in a bid to invest in Facebook, Google is hitting back.

headline.main: Google and Friends to Gang Up on Facebook

abstract: With a market value of $217 billion, Google is now worth more than all but four companies in the United States.
snippet: With a market value of $217 billion, Google is now worth more than all but four companies in the United States.
lead_paragraph: Much is made of round numbers. And so there will be some discussion today of Google’s stock hitting $700 a share.

headline.main: Bye Bye Pampers: Google Is Fifth Most Valuable Company
